image.altText: police and a police car at a rural property

props.synopsis: Police say no one was injured when a 20-year-old man allegedly shot at four men known to him.

title.children: Man charged after alleged attempted shooting in Canberra

image.altText: a school with a large sign reading st john paul ii college

props.synopsis: Parents of students attending Catholic and independent secondary schools in the ACT are facing school fee increases in 2025, including some by as much as 15 and 30 per cent.

title.children: Some ACT private schools facing fee increases as costs rise

image.altText: a man sits in the drivers seat of a car

props.synopsis: Some chargers along the Hume Highway have reportedly been down for months, meaning EV drivers are forced to plan ahead or take long detours. One driver says it made his "range anxiety" worse than usual this year.Â

title.children: 'Range anxiety' worse than usual for EV owners with chargers down and queues

image.altText: a mum with long brown hair and glasses kisses a six month old baby

title.children: New mums turned to a Facebook group for support, but things weren't as they thought

image.altText: A close-up shot of a doctor noting down symptoms of a patient on a form with a stethoscope hanging around his neck.

props.synopsis: A Canberra doctor has been accused of discrimination for cancelling a teenage transgender patient's routine appointment for adolescent vaccinations.

title.children: Human rights complaint made after transgender teen's GP visit cancelled

image.altText: A group of people in medieval dress pretending to fight.

props.synopsis: Live action role play is seeing a boom in popularity, with groups meeting up across the state to live out their medieval fantasies and find connection.

title.children: Fantasy fans taking up fake arms in 'medieval battle sport'

image.altText: Triple zero number about to be called on a mobile phone.

props.synopsis: Police say they also received a call from a university student who wanted their professor's contact details to request a deadline extension and a man who wanted a stray cat on his street to be arrested.Â

title.children: Calls to triple-0 included teen who lost internet, man who wanted stray cat arrested

image.altText: Rain clouds over an outdoor tennis court, with stands, with rain falling

props.synopsis: Former junior US Open winner Omar Jasika is the first Australian on court at his home slam, while 2024 women's finalists Qinwen Zheng and Aryna Sabalenka return to Melbourne Park on day one. Follow live

image.altText: An office worker talks on his phone as he looks the stock board at the Australian Securities Exchange

props.synopsis: It's widely accepted the US stock market, AKA Wall Street, is currently overpriced or overvalued.

image.altText: A man in a suit smiling and waving

title.children: A tiny Soviet state is in chaos. A shark-owning billionaire could be to blame

image.altText: Zelenskyy stands next to two burly soldiers in combat gear, all looking up to something above them

props.synopsis: Two North Korean soldiers fighting for Russia in Kursk have been captured by Ukraine's military, the president says.

title.children: Ukraine captures first North Korean soldiers, Zelenskyy claims

image.altText: Ash Gardner and Ellyse Perry high five each other near their Australian teammates

props.synopsis: Australia takes timely wickets to slow England's momentum in the first ODI of the Women's Ashes series at North Sydney Oval. Follow all the action from North Sydney Oval here.

title.children: Inside the lives of the people who live on the outskirts of Alice Springs

image.altText: A man sailing a yacht in the ocean

title.children: Search underway for 77yo sailor believed missing off WA coast

image.altText: a graphic of twins nuno and bruno da silva with a bike and palm trees behind

image.altText: A graphic image, half of two young girls smiling in a black and white photo, the other of the dunes of a beach.

image.altText: A large crowd of people gathered in a town square, with a large prominent sign reading 'Get Tough on Crime'

props.synopsis: The rate of Aboriginal people taken into custody in the NT each day has increased 123 per cent in the past five years. How did we get here?

title.children: Each day, 41 Aboriginal people are taken into custody in the NT

props.synopsis: Refreshed and relaxed after a little break? How nice. That ends now.

title.children: CCTV images released of suspects in Sydney synagogue swastika vandalism

image.altText: A close up of Donald Trump, wearing a suit, at a press conference.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump will aim to end the war in Ukraine within 100 days of re-entering the White House, the president-elect's pick for special peace envoy has said, rather than the previous 24-hour timeline that had previously been set.

title.children: Trump backtracks on pledge to end Ukraine war within day

image.altText: Three armed police officers in khaki uniforms walk down Bourbon Street

props.synopsis: Bodycam footage released by the New Orleans police department has revealed the end of the deadly attack carried out by a US Army veteran who killed 14 people on New Year's Day.

title.children: Video shows New Orleans attacker fired at police before they killed him

image.altText: A woman stands in a park holding her baby

props.synopsis: The social and cognitive benefits of knowing two or more languages, especially from childhood, are well-established. Here's how experts say it can be done.

title.children: How to raise bilingual children in Australia, where English reigns supreme

image.altText: Middle aged man looking at camera and smiling with hand on steering wheel, sitting on drivers seat.

props.synopsis: Electric vehicles represented almost one in 10 vehicle sales in 2024 but regional Queensland drivers are frustrated by the lack of public chargers.

title.children: Qld towns still waiting for public EV chargers years after promise

image.altText: A splay of Korean books with colourful covers overlapping.

props.synopsis: While K-lit might seem a world apart from its glitzy juggernaut cousin K-pop, its growing number of Australian fans say it is a thoughtful way to engage with Korean culture.Â

title.children: Korean books' 'quirkiness and subtle darkness' captivate Australians

image.altText: a man in a camo uniform holds two transparent plastic bags

props.synopsis: A soldier's brainwave has the potential to help provide a cheap, easy-to-replicate solution to the global IV fluids crisis, and other army personnel are being encouraged to get creative too.

title.children: 'Creative outlet' for soldiers producing game-changing inventions

image.altText: A Chinese man wearing a black muscle tee staring emotionless at the camera on a white door backdrop

props.synopsis: Since Myanmar's 2021 coup, criminal syndicate scam centres have thrived along the Thailand border, where hundreds of thousands of people have been forced into virtual slavery, with the latest among them appearing to be aspiring models and actors.

title.children: Fears male model who disappeared may have been trafficked to scam centre

image.altText: Two men in their bridal suits on their wedding day smiling beside a woman wearing a white dress and shell earrings.

props.synopsis: For Beth, Koraly and Sashi, broadening the idea of what makes a family has allowed them to create, celebrate and accept theirs.

title.children: 'More than enough': How three women embraced different types of family

image.altText: David Sedaris, a man in his 60s with glasses and a smart watch, smiles brightly, his hands touching his face.

props.synopsis: The American author is known for spending up to 10-and-a-half hours signing books for fans when he's on tour. He returns to Australia next month.

title.children: Why David Sedaris might not be a good person, except when he's on tour

image.altText: A group of six people sit around a table at a cafe.

props.synopsis: A Sydney woman caring for her grandmother with dementia has started a support group for young people struggling to come to terms with their loved one's illness.

title.children: Social media connects young people caring for loved ones with dementia

image.altText: A silver gull standing on wet sand with its reflection underneath it and blurred apartment towers behind it.

props.synopsis: Seagulls can get a bad rap for their chip-thieving exploits but there is more to them than meets the eye.

title.children: What you might not know about the seagull stealing your chips
